title: Bear Face

nouns: A large beast of prey of the family Ursidae, related to the dog and raccoon, having shaggy hair, a very small tail, and flat feet.
Massive plantigrade carnivorous or omnivorous mammals with long shaggy coats and strong claws
Any mammal of the family Ursidae; the bears
A large omnivorous mammal, related to the dog and raccoon, having shaggy hair, a very small tail, and flat feet; a member of family Ursidae, particularly of subfamily .
Bears are mammals of the family Ursidae.

description:
A friendly, cartoon-styled face of bear, looking straight ahead. Depicted as a brown bear with round ears and a tan muzzle. Resembles a teddy bear.

Often used with an affectionate tone. Does not have a full-bodied bear emoji counterpart.

May be used to refer to certain members of the LGBTQ community, a la the slang term "bear".

Available as an Apple Animoji.

Samsung’s bear was previously golden brown.
apple_vendor_description: Apple‚Äôs bear emoji is a charming, stylized rendering of a friendly bear, likely a brown or grizzly type, with a rounded muzzle and small, perky ears. Its fur is depicted with subtle shading and soft textures, giving it a cuddly and approachable appearance characteristic of Apple‚Äôs playful object designs. This emoji is commonly used to represent the animal itself, or metaphorically for strength, comfort, or even a hug, exuding a warm and reassuring presence on Apple devices.
